body_content.explanation: a set of metal or plastic containers fastened together one on top of another to hold different parts of a meal, traditionally used in India to carry a meal to eat at work or school:
examples: They serve excellent Indian takeaways in stacking tiffin boxes (plastic rather than the real Bombay metal ones).
A four-layer tiffin carrier packed by his mother sat at his feet.
I am loving my new tiffin tin. It's like a lunchbox for hot food - you could put rice on the bottom and curry in the top layer, seal it up and take it off to work.
